alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 2:11AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Snow accumulations 1 to 5 inches at lake level, 6 to 14 inches between 7000 and 8000 feet, and 14 to 24 inches above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph in lower elevations and up to 120 mph along Sierra ridges. Wave heights on Lake Tahoe 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, carry chains, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Be prepared for long travel delays or adjust your travel plans to avoid periods of heavy snow and white out conditions. The latest road conditions can be found by checking with CalTrans in California and NDOT in Nevada.
